title: Shopify Store Setup
description: Build a professional e-commerce store with Shopify from scratch

steps.title: Create Shopify Account
steps.description: Sign up for Shopify and start your free trial.
steps.instructions: Go to Shopify.com and click 'Start free trial'. Enter your email, create a password, and choose a store name. Shopify offers a 14-day free trial (sometimes extended to 3 days for $1).
tips: Choose a store name that's memorable and available as a domain
You can change your store name later
No credit card required for the trial

steps.title: Complete Store Setup Questions
steps.description: Shopify will ask some questions to customize your experience.
steps.instructions: Answer questions about what you're selling, whether you're already selling, your business goals, and your industry. This helps Shopify provide relevant recommendations.
tips: Be honest - this helps Shopify suggest the right tools
You can skip questions if unsure
These answers don't lock you into anything

steps.title: Choose and Customize Your Theme
steps.description: Select a professional theme that matches your brand.
steps.instructions: Go to 'Online Store' → 'Themes'. Browse the theme library and click 'Explore free themes' or check out paid themes. Click 'Try theme' to preview, then 'Publish' when ready. Use the theme customizer to change colors, fonts, and layout.
tips: Dawn is a great free theme for beginners
Make sure theme is mobile-responsive
Don't spend too long on design initially - focus on products
Paid themes ($180-350) offer more features but aren't necessary

steps.title: Add Your Logo and Branding
steps.description: Upload your logo and set brand colors.
steps.instructions: In the theme customizer, go to 'Theme settings' → 'Logo'. Upload your logo image (recommended size: 250x100px). Set your brand colors in the color scheme section. Update typography if desired.
tips: Use PNG format with transparent background for logo
Keep logo simple and legible at small sizes
Consistent branding builds trust
Use a free tool like Canva if you don't have a logo yet

steps.title: Add Your First Products
steps.description: Create product listings with images and descriptions.
steps.instructions: Go to 'Products' → 'Add product'. Enter title, description, price, and upload high-quality images. Add product variants (size, color) if needed. Set SKU and inventory tracking. Click 'Save'.
tips: Use high-resolution images (2048x2048px minimum)
Write detailed, benefit-focused descriptions
Add 4-6 images per product from different angles
Include product dimensions and materials
Use bullet points for key features

steps.title: Organize Products into Collections
steps.description: Create collections to help customers browse your store.
steps.instructions: Go to 'Products' → 'Collections' → 'Create collection'. Name your collection (e.g., 'Summer Sale', 'Best Sellers', 'New Arrivals'). Choose between manual selection or automated based on conditions. Add products and save.
tips: Create at least 3-4 collections
Use descriptive collection names
Add collection images for visual appeal
Automated collections save time as you add products

steps.title: Set Up Payment Gateway
steps.instructions: Go to 'Settings' → 'Payments'. Activate Shopify Payments (simplest option) or add third-party providers like PayPal, Stripe. Enter your banking information to receive payouts. Enable express checkout options (Shop Pay, Apple Pay, Google Pay).
tips: Shopify Payments has the lowest fees (2.9% + 30¢)
Always offer PayPal as an option
Enable express checkout for faster purchases
Verify your bank account to avoid delays

steps.title: Configure Shipping Rates
steps.description: Set up how you'll ship products to customers.
steps.instructions: Go to 'Settings' → 'Shipping and delivery'. Add shipping zones (regions where you ship), then set rates for each zone. Choose between flat rate, price-based, or weight-based shipping. Consider offering free shipping thresholds.
tips: Free shipping increases conversion rates
Offer free shipping over a certain amount
Use real-time carrier rates if shipping many different items
International shipping requires customs information

steps.title: Set Up Taxes
steps.description: Configure tax collection based on your location.
steps.instructions: Go to 'Settings' → 'Taxes and duties'. Shopify auto-calculates taxes in most regions. Verify your business address is correct. Enable automatic tax collection. Check if you need to collect taxes in multiple regions.
tips: US sellers: Sales tax is collected in most states automatically
EU sellers: VAT is required on all sales
Consult an accountant for complex tax situations
Keep records of all sales for tax filing

steps.title: Create Essential Pages
steps.description: Add legal pages and about information.
steps.instructions: Go to 'Online Store' → 'Pages'. Create these pages: About Us, Contact Us, Shipping Policy, Return Policy, Privacy Policy, Terms of Service. Shopify has templates for legal pages in Settings → Policies.
tips: Use Shopify's policy generators as a starting point
Legal pages build customer trust
Make policies easy to find in the footer
Write About Us in first person to connect with customers

steps.title: Set Up Your Domain
steps.description: Connect a custom domain to your store.
steps.instructions: Go to 'Settings' → 'Domains'. Either buy a domain through Shopify ($14/year) or connect an existing domain from GoDaddy, Namecheap, etc. Follow the instructions to update DNS records.
tips: Use .com if possible for credibility
Keep domain name short and memorable
Buying through Shopify is easiest for beginners
DNS changes can take 24-48 hours to propagate

steps.title: Launch Your Store
steps.description: Remove password protection and go live!
steps.instructions: Go to 'Online Store' → 'Preferences'. Scroll to 'Password protection' and uncheck 'Enable password'. Choose a Shopify plan (Basic at $39/month recommended). Enter payment details and click 'Select plan'. Your store is now live!
tips: Test the checkout process before launching
Share your store with friends for feedback
Install Google Analytics for tracking
Consider adding live chat for customer support
Announce your launch on social media
